conclusion: Objects A and B are fabric sheets that will fall due to gravity and interact with objects A, B, C, and D.

The image shows two fabric sheets labeled A and B positioned above a tabletop with blocks underneath. The blocks include a green/turquoise prism (C), a purple block (D), a yellow block (E), and another green/turquoise prism (F).
As soon as the fabric sheets are released, gravity pulls them straight down.
Each fabric sheet first makes contact with the tallest block that lies beneath it, which are the green/turquoise prisms (C and F).

Once the highest points are touched, the fabric sheets keep settling, bending, and folding until they touch the shorter neighboring blocks (purple block D on the left and yellow block E on the right).
The fabric sheets eventually settle and touch the tabletop after interacting with the blocks.
When all downward motion stops, each sheet is draped over its respective pair of blocks, with slack portions of cloth hanging in the gaps between and around the blocks.
The four corner pins of the fabric sheets remain fixed at the tray edge.
The two sheets simply drape under gravity and come to rest wrapped over the blocks underneath them.
